intro: Struthanthus microstylus, commonly known as the small-styled struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to dry conditions. It has slender, branching stems and small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
